name: Snowdon Sherpa S1
description: Vital link between Llanberis and rail network at Bangor.
adventure_tips: Connects to Snowdon trailheads (Llanberis Path, Pen-y-Pass). Best for train arrivals.

name: Snowdon Sherpa S2
description: Circular route connecting the east and west of Snowdonia.
adventure_tips: Ideal for completing linear hikes over Snowdon or the Glyderau.

name: Snowdon Sherpa S97
description: Dedicated Park & Ride shuttle for Snowdon.
adventure_tips: Direct to Pen-y-Pass. Use the Nant Peris car park to avoid congestion.

name: Snowdon Sherpa S4
description: Southern access route to the heart of the national park.
adventure_tips: Access from Porthmadog and Beddgelert. Stops at Pont Bethania for the Watkin Path.

name: TrawsCymru T2
description: Long-distance backbone connecting North and Mid Wales.
adventure_tips: Stops right at Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre. Scenic route along the coast and mountains.

name: TrawsCymru T4
description: The North-South backbone of Wales transport.
adventure_tips: Stops at Storey Arms for Pen y Fan. Great for accessing the central Brecon Beacons.

name: TrawsCymru T6
description: Direct link from Swansea coast to the Brecon Beacons.
adventure_tips: Stops at Dan-yr-Ogof caves and near Fan Gyhirych. Scenic ride through the valleys.

name: TrawsCymru T12
description: Key connector for the eastern border of Mid Wales.
adventure_tips: Connects historic market towns and provides access to the Berwyn mountains area.

name: TrawsCymru T1
description: West Wales link connecting university towns.
adventure_tips: Mix of coastal and inland scenery. Good for accessing the Ceredigion Coast Path.

name: TrawsCymru T5
description: The Ceredigion Coast backbone bus.
adventure_tips: Follows the coast closely. essential for linear walks on the Coast Path.

name: TrawsCymru T3
description: East-West explorer passing through the heart of the mountains.
adventure_tips: Stops at Llyn Tegid (Bala) and near the base of Cadair Idris.

name: TrawsCymru T10
description: North Wales connector linking the coast to the interior.
adventure_tips: Gateway to Eryri from the east. Connects with S2 at Betws-y-Coed.

name: TrawsCymru T19
description: Conwy Valley bus link running parallel to the train line.
adventure_tips: Useful alternative to the train. Stops in the centre of Betws-y-Coed.

name: TrawsCymru T22
description: Shuttle connecting the slate town to the coast.
adventure_tips: Provides access to Antur Stiniog downhill centre.

name: TrawsCymru T11
description: Pembrokeshire connector for the north-west tip.
adventure_tips: Links key coastal towns and the ferry port.

name: Puffin Shuttle 400
description: Coastal bus designed for walkers.
adventure_tips: Perfect for linear walks on the coast path. Stops at multiple trailheads.

name: Strumble Shuttle 404
description: Serves the rugged North Pembrokeshire coast.
adventure_tips: Access to Strumble Head and remote sections of the path.

name: Poppit Rocket 405
description: North coast path access bus.
adventure_tips: Stops at Poppit Sands, the start/end of the Pembrokeshire Coast Path.

name: Coastal Cruiser 387
description: South coast access to beaches and lily ponds.
adventure_tips: Access to Stackpole Quay, Bosherston Lily Ponds, and Fresh West surf beach.

name: Celtic Coaster 403
description: Frequent shuttle around the St Davids peninsula.
adventure_tips: Best way to reach Whitesands Bay and the lifeboat station.

name: Service 349
description: Mainline connector for south Pembrokeshire.
adventure_tips: Links the main towns. Good for accessing accommodation hubs.

name: Service 351
description: Coast path link for the south-east.
adventure_tips: Access to Amroth, the official start/end of the Coast Path.

name: Service 315
description: Access to the Milford Haven waterway and Dale.
adventure_tips: Stops at Dale for watersports and the peninsula walk.

name: Gower 118
description: South Gower backbone route.
adventure_tips: Stops near Three Cliffs Bay (Parkmill) and terminates at Port Eynon beach.

name: Gower 119
description: Alternative route to Rhossili via inland villages.
adventure_tips: Great for accessing Cefn Bryn and King Arthur's Stone.

name: Gower 114
description: North Gower scenic route.
adventure_tips: Follows the salt marshes of the Loughor Estuary before heading to Rhossili.

name: Service X43
description: East Beacons access bus.
adventure_tips: Stops in Crickhowell for Table Mountain and near the Sugar Loaf.

name: Service X1
description: North Coast express service.
adventure_tips: Fast access along the coast. Good for Wales Coast Path sections.

name: Service X4
description: Anglesey mainline route.
adventure_tips: Fast route across the island. Connects ferry port to mainland.

name: Service 42
description: West Coast explorer for Anglesey.
adventure_tips: Stops at Newborough for the forest and Llanddwyn Island.

name: Service 4
description: The Surfers Bus to Rhosneigr.
adventure_tips: Direct access to Rhosneigr beaches for windsurfing and kitesurfing.

name: Service X50
description: Access to Llandegla Forest.
adventure_tips: Stops near the entrance to One Planet Adventure MTB centre.

name: Service 83
description: Afan Forest access bus.
adventure_tips: Nearest public transport to Afan Forest Park trail centre.
